alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Perry (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 05 at 10:14PM CST until March 12 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Tennessee River at Perryville affecting Perry and Decatur Counties. For the Tennessee River...including Perryville...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Tennessee River at Perryville. * WHEN...Until Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 362.0 feet, In Perry County, Crooked Creek Campground and Marina near the boat launch area is flooding along with the access road to the camping area near the mouth of Crooked Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM CST Sunday the stage was 361.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 362.1 feet early Friday afternoon. - Action stage is 362.0 feet. - Flood stage is 365.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1015 AM CST.
